page.title: 12VOTING-PLAYING PLACE/KEA
page.content: People who live in this area on the {electoral roll}may vote in elections these are to elect councilors for:- 1.the{Parish Council,}which discusses local issues, 2.the{Carrick District Council, which decides local issues, 3.the{County Council,}which decides County issues. Electors may vote in{Parliamentary elections to choose an M.P.for our Constituency.Our{M.P.}at the moment is David Penhaligon. He is a member of the Liberal party.{Elections}take place every 4 years but do not all occur at the same time. Everyone over 18 is eligible to vote. The{elections take place at a polling station which is at the Playing Place village hall.Every person is checked in and goes to a private booth to mark their voting paper.
